text.*:
De Wallen red-light district in Amsterdam

Red-light districts are areas associated with the sex industry and sex-oriented businesses (e.g. sex shops and strip clubs). In some of these places prostitution may legally take place. Other red-light districts are known for their illegal prostitution scene (in countries where prostitution is illegal). In red light districts where prostitution is illegal prostitutes or clients may be arrested or fined if caught by the police (the enforcement of anti-prostitution laws varies by country or place).

Following is a partial list of well known red-light districts around the world, both current and historical.

Africa[edit]

Algeria[edit]

Prostitution is legal but third party involvement is prohibited.

See also: Prostitution in Algeria
  • Constantine
    • Rahbat al-Jammal (defunct)[1]

Burkina Faso[edit]

Prostitution is not specifically prohibited by the law,[2] but soliciting and pimping are illegal.[3]

  • Ouagadougou
    • Dapoya[4]

Egypt[edit]

Prostitution in Egypt is illegal.

See also: Prostitution in Egypt

Prostitution in Ivory Coast is legal.

See also: Prostitution in Ivory Coast

Prostitution is illegal.[6]

Malaysia[edit]

Prostitution in most of Malaysia is legal and widespread, though there are laws against prostitution-related activities. However, prostitution is illegal in Malaysia's Kelantan state.

See also: Prostitution in Malaysia

    • Bukit Bintang: Jalan Alor[58]

    • Lorong Haji Taib[58]

Prostitution is illegal, but in practice it is somewhat tolerated although not regulated.

Philippines[edit]

Prostitution is illegal, but widespread and generally tolerated.[63]

See also: Prostitution in Philippines

Singapore[edit]

Prostitution itself is not illegal; however, public solicitation, living on the earnings of a prostitute, and maintaining a brothel are illegal.[66]

See also: Prostitution in Singapore

Thailand[edit]

Soi Cowboy, Thailand

Prostitution is illegal in Thailand, and solicitation and public nuisance laws are in effect. In practice it is tolerated and partly regulated.

See also: Prostitution in Thailand

    • Patpong[69]
    • The western Sukhumvit Road area (notably including Nana Plaza and Soi Cowboy; formerly included the now-defunct Clinton Plaza)[70][71]
  • Phuket
    • Soi Bang-La – Patong Beach[72]
  • Pattaya[73]
    • Boyztown[74]
    • Sunee Plaza[75]
    • Walking Street[74][76]

Rue d'Aerschot, Brussels
Glazen Straatje, Ghent

Paying for sex is illegal, as is soliciting in a public place, operating brothels, and other forms of pimping.

Netherlands[edit]

Scene from Amsterdam's red light district
Achterdam at night (Alkmaar)

Prostitution and associated activities are legal and common. A total of 12 cities in the Netherlands have red light districts with window prostitution.[111]

United Kingdom[edit]

See also: Prostitution in the United Kingdom

England[edit]

Prostitution is not illegal when performed by a person acting alone in private, but public solicitation, brothels and pimping are. The Policing and Crime Act 2009 makes it illegal to pay for sex with a prostitute who has been “subjected to force” and this is a strict liability offence (clients can be prosecuted even if they didn’t know the prostitute was forced).[136][137]

  • Bolton
    • Breightmet Street (defunct) [11]
    • Lever Street/ Coe Street
  • Leeds
    • Holbeck - Under a scheme started in October 2014, initiated by West Yorkshire Police and Leeds City Council, sex workers may trade without fear of arrest on an industrial estate in Leeds' Holbeck district; providing they obey various rules, including only working between 7PM and 7AM and only working within the area.[138][139]
  • Leicester
    • South Highfields (defunct)[140]
  • London
    • Gropecunt Lane (possible medieval; defunct)[141]
    • King's Cross[142]

    • Soho[145]

    • Mapperley Road[148]

  • Wolverhampton

United States[edit]

Prostitution laws vary by state and territory, however it is illegal except for some rural counties of Nevada. Strip clubs are legal in most areas, including fully nude strip clubs. Many massage shops offer "happy endings", which is an illegal form of prostitution.

See also: Prostitution in the United States

    • Liberty Avenue (historical)[199]
  • Orlando, Florida
    • OBT, also known as Orange Blossom Trail (historical)[200]
  • Houston, Texas
    • The Bissonnet Track
  • San Antonio, Texas
    • Sporting District[201] (historical)
  • Waco, Texas
    • The Reservation[11]
  • Salt Lake City, Utah
    • Commercial Street (defunct)[11]
  • Washington, D.C.
    • 14th Street (Washington, D.C.) (historical)[11]
    • Pennsylvania Avenue (defunct)[11]
    • Vermont Avenue[11]

Oceania[edit]

Australia[edit]

Prostitution laws vary by state, either being legal or decriminalized.

See also: Prostitution in Australia
  • Adelaide
    • Hindley Street[202]
  • Brisbane
    • The Valley[203]
  • Melbourne
    • King St[204]
    • St Kilda[205]
  • Sydney
    • Kings Cross[206]
    • Darlinghurst/East Sydney[206]

New Zealand[edit]

Prostitution and associated activities are legal.

See also: Prostitution in New Zealand
  • Auckland
    • Papatoetoe, specifically Hunter's Corner[207]
  • Christchurch
    • Manchester Street[207]
  • Wellington
    • Vivian Street[207]
